column3: @sizeofvoid `--with-incompatible-bdb` will still be required to build with a bdb version other than 4.8, right?
Tend to NACK. We only officially support BDB 4.8 and make no guarantee to support any other version. I don't see why it is necessary to support an even older version of BDB.
NACK as is. It shouldn't be possible to build with anything other than 4.8, except through `--with-incompatible-bdb`.\n

> @sizeofvoid `--with-incompatible-bdb` will still be required to build with a bdb version other than 4.8, right?

On OpenBSD 6.3 and upcoming 6.4 with db-4.6.21 it fails also with `--with-incompatible-bdb`:
```
checking for Berkeley DB C++ headers... no
configure: error: libdb_cxx headers missing, Bitcoin Core requires this library for wallet functionality (--disable-wallet to disable w

Agree with the other comments, we shouldn't be making code-changes to allow for building with < 4.8. We also already provide a [db4 install script](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/contrib/install_db4.sh), which is the way we recommended installing BerkeleyDB in the [OpenBSD docs](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/build-openbsd.md#building-berkeleydb).
NACK, as stated above, only supported version is 4.8 and this should be closed.
@sizeofvoid It seems like the consensus is NACK. Does keeping this patch (perhaps with the suggested changes incorporated) in the ports system cause any trouble for the OpenBSD project? :-)

> @sizeofvoid It seems like the consensus is NACK. Does keeping this patch (perhaps with the suggested changes incorporated) in the ports system cause any trouble for the OpenBSD project? :-)\n\nNo, it doesn't.
Should check also for the relevant `DB_VERSION_MAJOR` number?
Should check also for the relevant `DB_VERSION_MAJOR` number?
And the file should be renamed..
> It shouldn't be possible to build with anything other than 4.8, except through `--with-incompatible-bdb`\n\nIs this required to build with < 4.8?
